body:
PR #22697 introduced a severe reproducible bug in commit 181a1207 that appears to cause the addrman tried table to become corrupt and significantly lose peer entries when the `-asmap` configuration option is used. 

The corruption occurs on bitcoind restart due to an initialization order change in `src/init.cpp` in that commit whereby CAddrman asmap is set after deserializing `peers.dat`, rather than before.

I reviewed that change and failed to see the bug until a few days after the merge.

Issue reported on the `#bitcoin-core-dev` IRC channel starting at https://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2021-08-23.html#l-263.

```
addrman lost 22813 new and 2 tried addresses due to collisions or invalid addresses
ADDRMAN CONSISTENCY CHECK FAILED!!! err=-17 bitcoind: ./addrman.h:707: void CAddrMan::Check() const: Assertion `false' failed. Aborted
```
 
How to reproduce:

- launch bitcoind with the `-asmap` and `-checkaddrman=1` configuration options enabled
- restart bitcoind
- bitcoind aborts on the second call to the addrman consistency checks in `CAddrMan::Check()`

This pull adds regression tests and patches the issue.
title: p2p, bugfix: fix addrman tried table corruption on restart with asmap
